t: Then*p I raised my eyes and looked, and behold, a man with a measuring line in his hand.
So I said, “Where are you going?” And*p he said to me, “To measure Jerusalem, to see what is*i its width and what is*i its length.”
And*p there was*i the angel who talked with me, going out; and another angel was coming out to meet him,
who said to him, “Run, speak to this young man, saying: ‘Jerusalem shall be inhabited as*i towns without walls, because of the multitude of men and livestock in it.
For I,’ says the Lord,*s ‘will be a wall of fire all around her, and I will be the glory in her midst.’”
Future Joy of Zion and Many Nations
“Up,*p up! Flee from the land of the north,” says the Lord;*s “for I have spread you abroad like the four winds of heaven,” says the Lord.*s
“Up, Zion! Escape, you who dwell with the daughter of Babylon.”
For*p thus says the Lord*s of hosts: “He sent Me after glory, to the nations which plunder you; for he who touches you touches the apple of His eye.
For surely I will shake My hand against them, and they shall become spoil for their servants. Then you will know that the Lord*s of hosts has sent Me.
“Sing*p and rejoice, O daughter of Zion! For behold, I am coming and I will dwell in your midst,” says the Lord.*s
“Many nations shall be joined to the Lord*s in that day, and they shall become My people. And I will dwell in your midst. Then you will know that the Lord*s of hosts has sent Me to you.
And the Lord*s will take possession of Judah as His inheritance in the Holy Land, and will again choose Jerusalem.
Be silent, all flesh, before the Lord,*s for He is aroused from His holy habitation!”
